author: wsjcom
title: Nobody Gets Fired When The Bureaucrats Mess Up
text:
I agree with Daniel Henninger’s assessment of the federal government as “too big to succeed” (“The FBI’s Parkland Fail,” Wonder Land, Feb. 22). There is an inherent lack of accountability in the public sector. We can expect that after an “extensive and thorough investigation” it will be announced once again that the failure was “systemic” in nature, which is government-speak for, “None of us are going to lose our jobs over this massive screw up.”
Oh sure, perhaps a political appointee or two will fall on their sword to stem...
